ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to watch movies through an analytical lenses and the very important lesson that everything is more complicated than it initially seems.

I learned a lot about the romantic comedy genre, what it means to define love on screen and how to critically analyze scenes. Through this course, I was able to expand my definition of a 'good movie' in the traditional sense and see the benefits of movies passed plot line or acting prowess.

This course fundamentally changed the way I see and think about love. The syllabus was very comprehensive and dug into several different units and focuses on love. Such a great course for learning about love.
I learned how to critically analyze American romantic comedy films and different ways of thinking about romance and genre.
I developed a really great appreciation and understanding of romantic film and the way it informs our own ideas of love.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was very well formatted and the instructor was open to change and feedback. The course load was a perfect amount and never a surprise or a burden.

This course was fun. I think there was too much reading assigned. Students did not read all the materials because it was too much, so the conversations were at point dry. Strengths were when the professor had us engage in activities about the materials.
The strengths of this course are the class discussions and the how interesting the material is. The weakness of the course is how much work is required.

The films and discussions in this class were very thought-provoking. The readings were a bit heavy at times, but Professor Forster did modify the workload based on our feedback. He also made sure everyone felt comfortable when sharing their thoughts and ideas.

The selection of films possessed a lot of range which was good, but I think there was sort of a loose definition of what qualified as romantic comedy and there were lots of shifts in genres being studied.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course! Whether you care about movies or not, this class will alter your understanding of how much they do or do not matter.

Yes, I would. I think it's a fun class for people who haven't had much experience in film studies. Forster is kind and smart about the subject matter and really wants to promote a good learning enviornment. It is a good amount of work, and he demands participation.
Would definitely recommend this class. Prof Forster is amazing and super knowledgeable about the material. I think that as long you are interested in the material.
Yes! The course material was very fun and interesting to engage with.
I would definitely recommend. Very good films and the professor was very knowledgeable on all the material and concepts.

I would recommend this course! If you are interested in romance and its intersections with identity I think its a great course to take. The readings and films we watched all went together well and exposed me to a lot of films I haven't seen. I've taken many film classes at Yale, and yet this class really shifted my view of film studies. Professor Forster is incredibly intelligent and thoughtful and put together a great syllabus and encouraged super interesting discussion. He gives pretty extensive feedback on work which is also helpful. However, I did find Professor Forster to be a bit rude and cold to students at times so please be prepared for that.

extras.title: AFAM 262 01/FILM 252 01 - Rom Coms and Cinematic Romance
